&appName; is a chemical kinetics simulation software package implemented in Java. This software can be used to define a system of interacting chemical species, and the reactions through which they interact. The software can then be used to simulate the reaction kinetics of the system of interacting species. The software consists of the following elements:
A set of Java packages or that (among other things) provides a Java application programming interface (or "API") for this software system. This set of Java packages is collectively known as the &localJavaLibraryName; library. There is Javadoc documentation available at the &localJavaLibraryName; page.
a scripting engine that can be invoked from the command-line, to define a model and run simulations on the model, and to export a model to a different model definition language
an implementation of the
Gillespie stochastic algorithm for simulating chemical reaction kinetics
a graphical user interface ("GUI") application that can be used to run simulations and export a model to a different model definition language
a Systems Biology Workbench bridge that allows the simulator to be invoked through the Systems Biology Workbench, using a model defined in the Systems Biology Markup Language
Models are defined in text files that you must edit, or generate using an external tool (e.g., JDesigner). This system can understand three types of model definition languages: two languages specific to &appName;, and the Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML).
NOTE: This is alpha (experimental) software. Please be patient while we fix bugs, add new features, and add (much needed) documentation. Your patience is appreciated.
